Transfer or handling of unusual compress.Data: Zeek http.log, Zeek file.log, Windows Event ID 4688, Windows Event ID 4663
Transfer or handling of unusual compress.Action: Monitor Zeek http.log and file.log for file transfers containing common compressed extensions (zip, rar, 7z, gz, sfx). Analyze Windows Event ID 4688 and 4663 for process creation or file access involving these extensions, especially in unusual locations or with suspicious command line arguments. Use frequency analysis on file extensions and names to identify rare or anomalous archives.

Presence of compressed or heavily encode.Data: Windows Event ID 4688, Windows Event ID 4657
Presence of compressed or heavily encode.Action: Analyze Windows Event ID 4688 for processes with unusually long or heavily encoded command lines, potentially containing compressed or encoded payloads. Monitor Windows Event ID 4657 for modifications to common registry keys used for fileless storage. Use entropy analysis on command line arguments or registry values to identify potentially compressed or encoded data.
